intro: Ilex dunniana, commonly known as the Chinese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has a slow growth rate, making it suitable for hedges or ornamental planting. Its foliage remains green throughout the year, providing year-round visual interest in gardens. Ilex dunniana is also valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
